vME2xybsiPjP_8nAKKySUw.text: To start, the environment is on point. The staff is friendly and the interior design is beautiful. My friend and I both got the Be Em's Signature Poke Bowl and it was delicious. The avocados weren't ripe and they forgot our seaweed salad inside the bowl, but it was still good. We also got the Kamikaze Kimchi Fries to share and it was really good. It was a bit salty for my taste but that's just me being picky. The price is a bit high to be honest but expected for how good the food tastes. I'd definitely come back again!

UEgO3_54Cj91JGEZ6qoVZw.text: Cook picking his nose. I was excited to try this new place. I've been there a few times since they've opened.  Unfortunately, today will be my last day going there.   The cooks are the same NASTY cooks from the previous restaurant called Shiki.  These are the same cooks you see sitting on buckets and the sidewalk at the back door of the restaurant.  I told the cashier that the cook was digging in his nose, and it wasn't just a simple wipe of the nose, he was digging hard and for about 20 seconds.  Although they've remodeled and the name has changed, there are still old disgusting habits since they're using the same cooks from Shiki. Never eating there again!!!

9J1Hq1o_ddZh2iJLNHFuWw.text: I have been on the hunt for good Asian food ever since moving to Charlotte two years ago. This place is a winner! The food comes out extremely fast and the presentation is beautiful. Will definitely be returning!

4W4IglT_JRRkfOM2pS3jIw.text: Delicious!!! Definitely a must try if you haven't already. Not your typical Asian fusion restaurant. Here you can get a taste of Vietnamese, and Korean at the same time! I had the Pho. It came with a big bone of beef rib that was oh so soft and tender. Broth was delicious. I also had the Kim chi fries which are highly addictive. Crispy waffle fries topped with beef and Kim chi. Definitely different than what I'm used to but it was amazing. Highly recommended. I'll be back for sure to try some of the other dishes that they have!!!

F26CaS3i5a4CMcbnnCJfWA.text: I've been here three times now and I absolutely love it!! The seared ahi nachos are delicious.

2XHw12tUYkB5_HAcf5TrEg.text: Simply amazing. Love the fusion of different foods,  I have yet to find something I haven't loved. Definitely recommend the poke bowls, wings, and the kimchi fries are to die for.

iahVt50Wqy-KUdib0NQ9Gg.text: My friend and I ate the cold noodle bowls. The names escape me now.... SO GOOD. Go there. Eat all the food. Amazing food.

XO-5zzMt1TQqUfBpOemCvg.text: I took my mom and kids here and they loved it, too! It's Asian Fusion and their food is full of flavor. There is a lot of seating and its easy to eat here with children. It's the type of place you can grab a quick bite to eat OR actually sit down and enjoy your time.

q-i_-aITkZf6y4n0Vfa_ZA.text: I will expand this post later but this place is spot on. No complaints.  Nachos awesome. Fries awesome. Poke bowl awesome. Tacos awesome.  Can't wait try more

B4AsUfpXRpZvnMwy5p6s1w.text: Delicious food, awesome vibes, clean restaurant. Well put together dishes. We ordered the shrimp vietnamese shrimp tacos, chicken pho, Korean bbq bowl, and Kimchi waffle fries. Portions were huge.

M-lxcohdrWdIfYPU1l_ZgQ.text: My new favorite and my boyfriend to-go-to spot to eat at! It was delicious! A mixture of Korean, Japanese and Vietnamese! Loved everything! Must give the oxtail soup, kimchi fries & steak tacos a try! You won't be disappointed at all! We will be back!

HpAMinrpedcljGAT2hoauQ.text: So I am a weekly dinner pick up since they opened! My favorite is the Be Em's Signature Bowl. My daughter is also a fan of their wings and hibachi entree. We also like the Vietnamese Street Tacos and is saving Pho for a day when we dine in. I've tried the Sesame Ahi Tuna Nachos and felt it was just okay. (a little salty for me) The service here is a little slow, but luckily you can go get your own drink refill and will not feel ill having to wait around. Overall the food here is good and the portions are good. You will be full and satisfy.

I ordered the steamed vegetables with Lo Mein....! The meals were reasonable priced, great customer service, the restaurant was very cozy and extremely clean. Definitely worth the stop.

DJU6WVUxFBDgQC4HWynotg.text: The worst poke bowl I have ever had. Don't come here please. I drove 15 mins for ice cold rice, 1oz of bad tuna and frozen pineapple.

pi14QaQKFUL1kA64sl_38Q.text: The Pho wasn't bad. Wasn't great either. Loved that they served the bread with it. Ingredients tasted fresh. Kim Chi waffle fries were also good. Was very pleased with the portion. The place was nice and clean. A little over priced for the food if you ask me. 3.5 stars.

xe71PxgnOf00Pxj9dtpxDQ.text: The ph noodle is too cook and the broth tastes so plain.  I ordered Ph Dac Biet, I think they left noodle and broth over night in the refrigerator and they just heat it up in the microwave when I order. Very unsatisfied.

fbZYGQmcStAA8HEisTk_YA.text: Great menu, great food, high quality ingredients. Something on the menu for everyone.  Prices are reasonable, ample portions and quite authentic. Casual and great service.  Grand Opening on Feb.12th but open for business when I was there on the 10th.   I will definitely be back.

aqC4CXGqwrUh_MqSt322dQ.text: We have been twice and neither time impressed. Dirty tables, food had no flavor and I saw one server cleaning the bathroom and then handling food without washing their hands. I was very excited about this place. I hope it improves.

RYUc0M5DqhXR_h_z2G3x6A.text: Overall all of the food was underwhelming, food was not seasoned and the carrots in this bowl were completely soggy and the shrimp sauce tasted off. The kimchi Fries we ordered weren't cooked all of the way so those were soggy too. I would pass on this place and go to Mr Tokyo, we won't be back to this place.

LOz1YLdajFEXaNmQ3tt7bw.text: Today was my first time trying them out. I had a few questions and the host/cashier explained the menu really well to me. These were the choices I went with;  Salad with ranch  Pan fried chicken dumplings  Chicken and shrimp teriyaki bowl with mixed veggies and fried rice  Onion soup and everything was good. It came super fast it could have been a little hotter but no other complaints. Food was good I will be back To try the beef bbq bowl and the Pho

-zjb4VnaKI03soSC-0PR4w.text: Heard of this place on IG and decided to check it out. Did not disappoint! Everything we had was delicious and the portions were very generous. The edemame in sweet chili was so good. Very affordable and great atmosphere. Friendly staff.

mrS1G9StCSzkzahv0XxiFg.text: The pho was ok but the kimchee fries was surprisingly impressive. The popcorn chicken was good with the perfect flavor so don't think of it as the popcorn chicken from kfc or the frozen ones.   The pole bowl was okay and the wings were so good! We had both flavor and it didn't disappoint at all! Give it a try!

qQl7Ruwelnix9Ce4qb1Tww.text: this is the best food bar none.   My husband tries different things but I love the scallops with mushrooms and sauteed onions so much that I just HAVE to get that.  I would liove it if you'd get a wine and or beer license or a permit for BYOB

E6iecSfFHbN6K0D9Hy4W1w.text: Today I was so hungry and I was craving some great (ny style Asian) food. Now anyone living outside of the best Chinatowns for food you will understand that statement. So to my surprise this Asian food was the closest I've had in years to NYC Chinatown food. The service was quick but nothing over the top but the food was so good. I had fried rice, pan fried dumplings, and a lettuce wrap all four 15.00 dollars. I was so delighted  I will be coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of Be-Em Asian Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. lettuce wrap and potstickers

Sq2VGiCF9vQDcACrpQPZmA.text: I placed a to go order. I asked for no sweet carrots and replace with extra veggies. I was told it would be $3 more. I agreed. Of course my order had the carrots on it. The cashier took my food and a spoon and scooped it off. She did not wash her hands. I asked was the carrots just scooped off because the rice will taste like those carrots. My order was remade. No apology given.

4YxbOaGjsoPLRWPswMf5aw.text: Decided to come here tonight with my fiance. Upon walking in the place seems large and spacious and seemed well decorsted and clean. It is somewhat fast casual. We walked up to the counter and ordered Vietnamese beef tacos, beef rib pho and the Hawaiin poke with spicy tuna instead of plain tuna. The food was awesome! The taco were actually filling. We go three on a plate with generous portions of beef, cilantro, carrots and green onions and a spicy mayo sauce. Next was the poke bowl that may have been one of the best bowls I have had in Charlotte. It was loaded with rice, avocado, pineapple, masago, and of coarse tuna and some delicious sweet sauce. Then there was the massive bowl of pho. The broth was pristine clear and savory with beef and vietnamese aromatics. There was a very generous portion of beed. This has to be one of the best meals I have had in a while and will soon be a regular.

photos.caption: Photo of Be-Em Asian Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Korean bbq bowl
Photo of Be-Em Asian Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Hawaiian Poke bowl with spicy tuna

E8jygj7KapA2IoHzAu84Zg.text: So disappointed my bland onion soup spilled everywhere in my bag. The onion soup didn't have the fried onions. No shrimp sauce to be found. This was my go to spot. The hibachi was so bland and veggies nearly raw. Not as much as an apology for the poor service. Don't know if I'll be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Be-Em Asian Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States

pkhwT_BkrpxPQUhJt6p7bw.text: Ordered 4 plates and 2 appetizers all vegetarian for $45. The food was decent however they messed up my sons order. We all got our food and my 10 year old got the wrong item. They took it back and we're sitting here waiting for him to get his food while ours gets cold. The mixup is not a big deal and still would have resulted in 5 stars. This place is getting one star because it's been 39 minutes since my son returned his order, my food is cold, everyone in line has been served, the portions are small and we ended up walking out without his food and returning my plate. While this was a one star upon us waking out the door we brought it to their attention and the owners apologized, recooked our plates, refunded the 2 uneaten meals and remade them fresh! It is service like this that makes you feel valued! Great finish to a rough start.

NIAJHTAvcffHGykcNeetJg.text: We had dinner here a while back but since they had recently opened I didn't want to give a negative review yet. Now that it's apparently been rated one of the best Asian restaurants in Charlotte (really???) I'm comfortable putting in my 2 cents.  The prices are reasonable, the presentation is excellent for a casual restaurant and service is super, that why I rated it 3 stars  The food, on the other hand, is not bad but it's bland, boring, meh.  We had the "signature" poke bowl and as much as I appreciate its price being a couple or three dollars lower than at better poke eateries it still was not good enough that I'd order it ever again. The Kamikaze Kim Chi fries were fast food kind of terrible and the Vietnamese street tacos with shrimp were OK, but there's a lot better all over town these days.  Overall 2 stars for the food, raised to 3 because of price and presentation.

xiXB_9Zrmgs761RN59KLzQ.text: The food was fresh and hot and there was plenty for me and my son to share. I didnt have to wait long for the food. The staff was friendly and even played with my son while I juggled the items in my hands to pay. Would come back

photos.caption: Photo of Be-Em Asian Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States

THZP83KZtcCJW5rwBglVdg.text: Everything is awesome about this new joint! There is not a detail spared in the cleanliness of this restaurant. The food is amazing, full of flavor, plus the portions are out of control! Enough to share for 2-3 people. It is a little on the double digit side of cost, but the price is worth the quality of the ingredients. I'm so thankful they opened it up close to home. Staff is awesome and friendly. Will definitely be back and have already told friends about it. It is across from the Walmart in the Galleria shopping center.   I had the Kimchi fries and the vietnamese shrimp tacos. Next time, I would ask for the sauce to be put on the side, since the sauce kind of soaked into the tortilla. Other than that, great experience all around.

fh4DnaQD1zi12XRF1uKqHA.text: Poke bowl was great, lots of veggie and reasonable amount of fish plus two tempura shrimps. Also ordered Korean chicken, it looks super awesome when the chef brought it, but damn it was SO SO SO salty, ... Hope they can adjust their recipe so it's more tolerable, I'm usually big on flavored foods, but this is definitely way too much sodium for anyone.

tdD7uAM1KIHNyH2TJSzPLQ.text: Organic? Local? And family owned? I am here for it. When dining at Asian fusion spots I am quite skeptical being that I am Vietnamese American. Be-Em Asian Kitchen has hit the nail on the head with their attentive staff, large portions and the inviting atmosphere. Their menu is the perfect size, not too little, not too small. Less is more.

photos.caption: Photo of Be-Em Asian Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pho Dac Biet - my absolute favorite!
Photo of Be-Em Asian Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. I HIGHLY recommend the KBBQ Beef bowl - the sushi rice and sweet marinade really compliment each other.

WBQ4lI_TPDau5IKKcPcTRA.text: I came in for their first day open. Cutest little spot. It's like a Panera bread kinda service. You order at the counter but then they bring you the food. We had the chicken egg rolls, Thai chili chicken wings and Korean bbq bowl. Everything was soooo good and came out really fast. Also, it felt good to know I was eating at an eco friendly restaurant where even their to go boxes are biodegradable. Will be back

photos.caption: Photo of Be-Em Asian Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Korean bbq bowl
Photo of Be-Em Asian Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Thai chili chicken wings

nA3vchwz5VzNOGTfkFk1Xw.text: Went here because I was looking to try out another Asian restaurant and this was my second choice. I ordered the wings, their signature rice bowl and a miso soup appetizer and my total came to approx $25 and I was pleasantly surprised. The wings are exceptional and very crunch I was very pleased. I just wish there were more flavor options for them. The rice bowl was very good, very hearty I just wish I had a little more meat and a little less rice. I give this place 4 stars because the food was great, service was also really good and the interior was gorgeous. I hope that they can expand a bit more in their drink options as well since they only serve foundation drinks and water currently.

photos.caption: Photo of Be-Em Asian Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States

LNhJPw6ZDzPTpOJhun2U7Q.text: We have ordered from Be-Em numerous times over the last few months! The food is fresh and delicious! However, don't order the $3 ginger salad! It was a handful of wilted lettuce -- that's it!! No tomato, no cucumber and the ginger dressing was not my favorite:( otherwise we LOVE EVERYTHING else we've ordered! So glad they are in the neighborhood!

wvBdo4FtbPU8PInnh61kLQ.text: Vietnamese street tacos are amazing. Pho very good as well. We need more healthy-ish restaurants like this. We'll be back a lot.

_9hTBJ5ziNcJP_7jLHiZ_Q.text: I've been here 4 times in the past month. Before it was Be-Em, it was Shiki, a spot I came to a lot. First thing I noticed, management hadn't changed. Same guy was running the place so I figured same quality of food. And I think I'm right, because the food is alright. I've had Vietnamese Tacos, the Beef Bulgogi Bowl, the Signature Poke Bowl, the brisket Pho. I've also sampled the hibachi chicken and tuna nachos. I will give a quick review now if each meal: Out of all these meals, the Vietnamese tacos are undoubtedly the best thing I've had. I'm a big fan of banh mi, and those tacos were on point. The Bulgogi bowl is alright, not a huge fan of the kimchi that comes with it. The hibachi chicken is ok, nothing crazy about it. The pho definitely lives up to the hype, very delicious. The poke is good, nothing special about it. And finally, the tuna nachos are a strange concept, essentially sushi nachos, but taste good. My goal is to try everything, so far, they haven't disappointed.

Y8-hC8vg5Uyb_VZPg80Ncw.text: We ordered takeout from here tonight. Well, we thought we were ordering Shiki, but once we got there to pick up, we realized it had changed to Be-Em. The food was delicious. We ordered the spring rolls, then chicken and scallops with noodles and veggies, and chicken and steak with noodles and veggie. We will definitely be back! The interior has been updated and the rest of the menu looks worthy of a few visits.

BtJK_tBp-qW846E0e2GDNQ.text: Good food, Good Ambience and quick service. We ordered chicken dumplings, Vietnamese street tacos and spring rolls. Everything tasted good. I wasn't a big fan of chicken popcorn. It seemed to have an issue with oil it may've been fried in that ruined the flavor. We'll certainly like to go back to try other items on the menu.

zj4Gg39wb-1ZUwfm-caIjQ.text: My husband and I had pho ga and shared a fresh coconut. The presentation of the pho was really lovely and the dish itself was very good. Delicious food, excellent prices.

lvFa5c4KKiV3nv4pmIU-0w.text: Solid, quick spot. Good variety on the menu that can satisfy any palate. Have not tried the pho, lot of competition around this part of town, but the Korean and Japanese selections have been fresh and delicious so far. Recommend trying at least a couple different things on the menu. Good to see a strong fast-casual restaurant in the center.

CboV_7mRDU49aaskT2mJKg.text: My first reaction was, wow! It's so beautiful. You walk in, and order your food first. Then you grab your number, and choose a table. They brought our food out super fast! We got the short rib pho, kimchi fries, soy wings, and the lettuce wrap. Everything was so flavorful. Can't wait to go back!

R1i4sDEf2lwb60JVic-xWw.text: The food was decent and cooked well. I ordered the poke bowl.. the tuna was definitely more fatty and chewy than any I've tried before but wasn't terrible or anything. The seasonings were very much not where I expected somewhere with such high ratings to be and whatever that was they called seaweed salad was mush. You can't substitute things so I hope you like what is on the menu as is. The lack of ability to create your own bowl along with the flavors of the food puts this place at the bottom of my going back to list...

vI0d3jb6mMWITlI9gbWH6g.text: I got the Shrimp Hibachi with sweet carrots and broccoli. It was delicious and a lot of food at a great price. It's also nice that you can choose Gluten Free soy sauce if you've got an allergy.

gkO-7gSHpR6-FLHn0nFNog.text: Yelp recommended this place and I am so glad it did! I had the pho with chicken and it was so good. My first time having pho and was very impressed with the broth and additions that came with it. I added the lime and jalapeno, but passed on the tai basil since I don't like licorice. The bowl was huge and filled to the rim. It was triple the size I could eat myself but my husband didn't mind helping! He thought he didn't like rice noodles until he tried these and he was very impressed. My husband ordered a plate with teriyaki steak, mixed veggies, sweet carrots, and fried rice. The pieces of steak were tender and the rice had good actual flavor, unlike other restaurants rice that can be a bland afterthought. We also ordered the crab wontons, which came with a sweet and spicy sauce. They came out very hot, but were very tasty. The service was very friendly, answered all my questions, and the kitchen was fast. Everything came out looking like a magazine photo with beautiful presentation. The portions were very adequate for the price. The atmosphere is wonderful and staff keeps it very clean and tidy. I will definitely be including this place in our regular restaurant cycle.

e0jNAyaOge-79PC3qGvsSg.text: Great food, great service! Found this earlier in the week, and we have already returned. They've only been open a week, but the team is doing a great job.

7b6hkoswju66xJnSxv0-8A.text: One of our new favorite spots! If you're looking for delicious Asian food this is the place to go! The interior is modern and spacious along with the food being plated beautifully! Their Kamikaze Filet Kimchi Fries are definitely a must to try when you go there, super crispy and flavorful while being aesthetically pleasing. Also the Poke Bowls are very filling and worth the price, highly recommend checking this place out for your Asian food cravings!

photos.caption: Photo of Be-Em Asian Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Kamikaze Filet Fries-Absolutely flavorful and crispy!
Photo of Be-Em Asian Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Left Bowl: Crunchy California Bowl. Right Bowl: Korean BBQ Beef Bowl. Both delicious and filling, worth the price!

MjWUG6bkgG1pK6qaa1Y1og.text: The food was good, I feel like it is a fair portion compared to what I paid. I went with the chicken and steak hibachi and it was really good. I did add a little soy because I like a little more bold flavor but it was still good before I added it. It came with a soup and a salad. The soup was your standard soup with onion and the salad was just lettuce with ranch. I was expecting at least some carrot or something else but the main course more than made up for it as it was a large portion and tasted really good. It isn't busy right now (330 pm) and the food was on the table within 5 minutes and everything was done and hot so you know it was freshly made.  Definitely coming back soon!   Also I do like the atmosphere here. The greenery although it is fake it still looks good in this modern style location.

FpW3da0zTfr-jW0hlQF_oQ.text: This restaurant is extremely aesthetic and I'm here for it. The food is plated beautifully and vibrantly.    We went all out and got a whole spread: chicken fried rice plate, pork fried rice plate, king salmon bowl, be-em's spring rolls, be-em's famous savory soy wings, and coconut. The wings were crispy and meaty, and the flavoring was a sweet soy glaze that was a new flavor. I've had soy wings at KFC (Korean fried chicken) places typically but it's never been sweet before, so this was a great rendition of that.  The egg rolls were c r u n c h city and filled with chicken and veggies! The outside wasn't oily (thank you so much because I have a sensitive stomach when it comes to oil ) . The Thai chili sauce was a great compliment to the filling but I honestly didn't need any sauce on mine. My king salmon poke bowl was filled with fresh ingredients and the portion sizes were fantastic. I loved everything about except for the spicy mayo sauce. I just felt that there was a bit too much spicy mayo but I'm not a huge fan of mayonnaise in general.  The chicken and pork entrees were large in size as well. The dish Is like a hibachi grill but not as greasy in my opinion.  Highly recommend this place

1Hdw3egsldXLUOdPxbzMHQ.text: Overall, a pretty darn good place for Pho or other Asian dishes. Very interesting atmosphere with grassy art all over the walls.  Go to the counter, order your food, and they bring it to your table.  The servings are huge.  I had a tofu plate with brown rice and vegetables. I ordered the grilled tofu, but they brought me the fried tofu. It was an error, but I didn't send it back. Deanna had the pho with chicken.  There were so many noodles in her bowl that she could have shared it with everyone living in South Charlotte.  I was actually going to order the pho, but it came with only beef broth.  The lady behind the counter promised me that they would soon have other broth options.  This was a fun spot that is getting a lot of good Yelp attention.  Thankfully, Yelp continues to guide me in the right direction!

Photo of Be-Em Asian Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States

XgPcEzwgQxYRfUKJ3ytL2w.text: The Koji chicken is scrumptious, the thai sweet chili wings are delicious. For something, sweet and refreshing i recommend the lychee love drink.

mWPP18I21NmaNIDVQqDXbQ.text: TLDR: The food is Asian fusion and delicious. The service is fast. The servers are quiet. I highly recommend the Korean beef bowl.

bORhjJjZiKIPB85aqLYVng.text: Spicy, hot, healthy, clean, friendly,  fast service, totally delish.  Five delishes!!!  Thanks Be-Em

V62XmZs_lqyhEt-ZXAlkNg.text: Not a very good first impression. Got the veggie plate and the only thing hot on there was the rice and the hibachi sauce it came in. The only good thing I could say is that the food Portion was wonderful. I asked for a takeout box so I could heat it up later when I had time. The veggie spring rolls came out later than my food. They were hot. But tasted greasy inside. I made the front counter staff aware and they we're making the kitchen staff aware. No one bothered to come out front to speak to me about it. Wonderful customer service huh? Oh well. I'm just glad there are other places around to order from. The two stars is for the food Portion only.

photos.caption: Photo of Be-Em Asian Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States

Qk2Nk4Mpg9Ifv4r4T0bf7w.text: Wow, I cannot believe I just found this place. We had plans to go to another new Asian restaurant across town that fell through so we were craving some good lo mein. Be-Em did not disappoint! The plate portions are huge and the food was delish. The tofu was perfectly cooked, crispy on the outside and well flavored.   Like honestly, drop what you are doing and go there right now!

zkrSTGNfC1ulv0KglEdkvQ.text: Ok so this place is literally 5 minutes away from me. It previously was shiki- a Japanese restaurant that was here for years. I literally only went there a handful of times. Not sure if this place is same owners but it is a significant upgrade. So pretty inside and love the branding. You order at the counter and then they give you a number and will bring your food to the table. This is a Asian restaurant which has Japanese, Vietnamese, and Korean dishes. They also have poke bowls. Truly something for everyone.     I ordered the chicken and steak hibachi entree. My husband had the Korean bbq beef bowl. My entree came with soup and salad and the bowl had fried rice, brocolli and zucchini, sweet carrots and chicken/shrimp. It was a very large portion. I really enjoyed it - it was delicious. The Korean bbq beef bowl was also very good. We really like Korean bbq flavors. I think it is going to be one of the most popular dishes here.     Other menu highlights include Koji karaage chicken which is a fried popcorn chicken with sweet chili sauce- I want to try this next time! Also the street tacos sound great!   The staff were all super friendly and helpful. I will absolutely be back soon!!

7W5-S9YeG6O6DDJq_dmpPg.text: This was an amazing dinner spot! I live less than a mile away and always drove by this place wondering if the food was good. My friend Jane and I decided to dine there this evening. We ordered the spring rolls, kamikaze filet kimchi waffle fries, teriyaki chicken and rice, Vietnamese beef street tacos, and a Korean BBQ beef poke bowl. I also had the passion fruit tea. Every single thing was superb. The kamikaze filet kimchi fries were my absolute favorite. The manager came out to greet us, and told us to order what we wanted and she would take care of it. The staff brought out all of our food and was really accommodating. They checked on us throughout the meal to ensure we didn't go without anything we needed. Being that the restaurant is so close to me I will definitely be back in to dine.

ooKaprtn4z-Uya-KEGxtvg.text: So after being opened for 3 months, I finally decided to go give this place a try since they added drinks to their menu. I ordered the oxtail pho, Korean beef bowl, kamikaze fries, Thai tea with grass jelly & my fave the fresh coconut.   Rating for the food: the pho broth was phenomenal. So clean, simple and fresh! First time I had pho that I didn't have to add any extra sauce or ingredients to it. Just wow! Buuuuut, even though the broth was so good unfortunately the noodles were over cooked. Korean beef bowl was a little sweet for me but the kimchi was awesome! Kamikaze fries: the fries were cold and tasted old but I bet if it came out hot, it would have tasted even better. Now for the drinks, I'm a self proclaimed Thai Tea connoisseur. Lol. I love Thai tea, it's one of my go to drinks when I'm at an Asian restaurant. The Thai tea was good and the grass jelly also tasted fresh made. Lastly, for the one thing that made me drive 30mins out for, the fresh coconut drink. The drink itself was so refreshing and getting to eat the coconut meat after finishing the drink made it even better. Only thing that upset me the most about the coconut drink is that it didn't come out with the restaurant logo stamp on it. Like really people! Presentation is everything! I asked the server why mines didn't come out with a stamp and she just gave me a shoulder shrug and replied "I don't know". Um, okay.   As for customer service, ugh! Absolutely horrible. The girl in the front taking my order had absolutely and I mean absolutely no knowledge of the menu. I had asked for a few recommendations of what to get and she also said, "I don't know". Um okay. I then proceeded to ask which pho had the bone in, her answer "Oh, I don't know". I mean, if you don't know the answer you can easily go to the back and ask. After that, I was just ready to place whatever order and just get my food. Nothing ruins a place more than having sucky service with a worker who doesn't have any knowledge about the menu.  As for the inside, it was modern and clean. They are quick to clean a table after the customer leaves.  I'll definitely be giving this place a second chance because the pho broth was so good, but customer service needs improvement.

My wife and I both had the Chicken and Shrimp Combo meal, which was piled high, piping hot and delicious! At $13, it also came with a side salad with savory ginger dressing AND soup.  Presentation was beautifully done and the service was very friendly and cheerful. Sanitation score was 95.  I really enjoyed the unique small touches such as the IKEA serving boards on which our meal was delivered, the whimsical ivy covered wall and even their classy carry out boxes.  For me, except for being a bit pricey, they checked all the boxes. Even when it comes to price, however, they provide exceptional value considering their serving sizes. We intend to be back.

ipMaWJlt3Zmt9rhpj_nlhQ.text: Be Em restaurant is incredible, we used to go to Shiki all the time so when we saw this new restaurant in January we were confused and apprehensive the restaurant was really lovely inside the updates they made where great. However they no longer have table service and the menu had almost completely changed the first time we tried it we were not overly impressed. I keep up with restaurants in our area to see what's good and I saw the 5 star reviews from Be Em and decided to try it again today and I am so happy I did! My niece got Steak and shrimp and she are every bite. They also have Pho, Poke and at least 10 different kinds of fruit and bubble teas. I recommend you go get your BE EM on immediately.

5U6NKGple9CpAhjbb-AXGw.text: Since moving to this part of CLT, I'm able to explore new restaurants. Asian cuisine is my favorite and I had to try this place out.   The reviews on here looked awesome and the food presentation is A1. I asked my bf if we should try it out and he was down. My bf got the Korean bbq bowl and I opted for the kamalazie kimchi fries. I wanted the Korean bbq bowl too but since this was our first time trying this place, I thought we could share meals.  I'm glad I got the fries because they are really good!! My only concern was that I wish it was a better helping like in the dine in pics.. However, as you can see it was enough for one person. I smashed it. The sauces are so good and using waffle fries is the best for this dish. Also, the food wasn't hot. My bf even said his bowl was lukewarm  My bf's bowl was really good. The bulgogi is so flavorful. Kimchi and egg. Perfection. I can't wait to try more from their menu. Looking for a good Korean fix? Try this place out!!

w975DJkgoZ2koCvgt3b_gQ.text: This is my favorite asian restaurant.  Service is excellent...they are so friendly and happy! I love to come here. Food presentation is great, and the restaurant atmosphere is great too. Very clean and modern.  They have great pho.

akrwCuXqU_Db6z2SqewdCA.text: This one has been on my radar for quite some time. The only thing that has kept me from this gem is the commute. I am a firm believer that if I'm going to drive somewhere simply for food and it's not convenient to what I have going on that day let the food be worth driving for.....I must say Be-Em definitely exceeded my expectations. The creative concept of the restaurant when you walk in is breath taking for it to be so limited in space. I remember the restaurant that was in this location before them and boy am I glad how things have changed. I ordered the veggie dumplings, scallop plate with mixed veggies and fried rice, and the strawberry blitz refresher as a recommended compliment to my meal. They are very quick and the system behind how you order and delivery of your food works for them! So I have no complaints about service. The food was very fresh and full of flavor and the refresher was sooooo good I had no need for dessert. The only reason I took one start away is because for a new timer some things were a little confusing. I needed little things like side dishes or extra napkins and didn't know if I had to walk up or some one would serve us and at the end of the meal I didn't want to be rude but didn't know if I left my plates on the table or they had a trash area for me to clean the tray myself something that could fixed with a sign maybe? Overall, I would and already have recommended this place to others and am glad it is here for the foodies

p6NW-33EUZqau87nRLzsSA.text: This was my third time coming to Be Em and I couldn't be any more impressed with what they have to offer and of course, share with my friends! With each visit, I ordered something different to get a variety of taste. The quality and freshness of the food, amiable environment and staff, and service as you walk into the doors... A+. My experience was great each time; there is plenty of seating indoors and outside and the decoration is beautiful.   The items that I have with images:  Crunchy California Bowl: my second time ordering this!! It is perfect for someone who isn't a raw sushi fan. There's crab meat, avocado, spicy crab, cucumber and tempura crunch topped with eel sauce (my favorite!) For the price of this, it is definitely worth it due to the freshness of each topping of this poke bowl.  Crispy wonton bites: basically cheese wontons or crab rangoons.. however, you would like to call it!   Korean BBQ Beef Bowl: Beef, fried egg, kimchi! and you can see... I got the wontons again (no regrets)   Koji Karaage Chicken: IDK how to pronounce this BUT THIS WAS SO GOOD. Whatever they did to this... I want the recipe.   NEW BOBA/TEA/DRINKS!!!! Honestly, would come back for the drinks.  Lychee Love: refreshing with fruits!  Oreo Cookies and Cream: with roasted oolong tea... yummy omg. I felt like a little kid using my spoon and trying to grab all of the oreos out of the cup.  and Cafe Sua Da, Vietnamese coffee with sea salt cream !   Overall experience: I would definitely come back for the koji chicken, poke bowls and their drinks. I'm impressed with the presentation, the tray, and the amount of food they give for each dish. It was definitely, definitely worth it.

q_jNLIYLqJDeN5lyyDdmIQ.text: Found this place online after a long drive. We ordered takeout. We tried a bunch of different food and it was all delicious. Street tacos, Korean barbecue bowl, firecracker shrimp and the waffle fries with kimchee and Korean bbq.  Will definitely be back next time we are in town!

BHyE8GQ3utTRS-JGLHXv9w.text: A recent favorite find and I've been addicted ever since! I'm usually not a huge fan of Asian fusion restaurants as it's often difficult to retain quality (in my opinion). I've tried a bit of everything and I have to say Be Em does a good job of marrying different flavors, textures and cuisines.  Favorites: Kimchi Fries: bulgogi, kimchi, sriracha, cheese, magic?, etc on a bed of WAFFLE FRIES. I would live on this   Ahi Tuna Nachos: the tuna was incredibly fresh and the flavors delish! In fact, they were sold out last time I went so I assume this is a general favorite   Good: Teriyaki: I've tried the teriyaki steak with scallops. Good portion and flavor.   Poke Bowl: I tried the salmon one. I thought the flavor was great along with the size of the bowl, but wish there were more salmon pieces. This was mom's favorite :)  Wouldn't Recommend: Wings: I got the savory soy and the flavor just seemed off. The soy sauce was thicken to almost a bitter taste while the wings seem a bit dry  Match Milk Tea: while this was decent, definitely not the usual milk tea quality I'm used to. I know they recently added all of their teas so hopefully it'll improve in the near future   Would love to come back and try the pho next time!

HVXmLa54JfTHjqcZcGYTFQ.text: The food here is delicious. Order food here like a fast food place, the cashiers are very rude and have a horrible attitudes. The people that bring out the food are super nice tho.

zTeYk3th_AU4FLT7skIrYA.text: Last night I finally was able to try Be-Em! The location is on the corner in the Wal-Mart shopping center and easy to get to. There is both indoor and outdoor seating. It was so pretty inside that we chose to sit inside. I really loved the details of light fixtures.   We walked up to the counter and ordered the Vietnamese Street Tacos- steak, Be-Em's famous wings- Thai sweet chili and I had the Bulgogi bowl. I couldn't decide on what to drink so I had two!! The fresh coconut and the lychee love (thinking I would take the Lychee Love to-go). The coconut was fresh with plenty of coconut water and the lychee love was extremely refreshing that I drank it all during dinner!   I really loved the street tacos, if you love eating Banh Mi then it is the same fun flavors but in a taco form. The Chicken wings were so crispy and I really love crispy wings. The bulgogi bowl was a great portion and I definitely am excited to eat the leftover for lunch today. We were thinking that their small plates were going to be like restaurants in uptown where they barely give you any food. But it was a pleasant surprise that the small plate portions were so big.

u_7vblf2U_7r7A5bsQr4rA.text: I was in the area meeting a friend for lunch and we were both craving Asian food so we decided to give this place a try.  Walking in, you can't help but notice their "earthy" interior.  They even have parts of the wall covered in moss.  Pretty cool and definitely fits the style of being organic and environmentally friendly.    I went with the Be-Em Signature Poke Bowl and it was delicious!  The portion was more than enough for lunch, so I found myself eating the rest for dinner that night.  I was debating whether or not to order their tiramisu dessert drink because I'm sure it's full of calories but I figured this could be my cheat meal for the week.  I definitely don't regret that decision!   Overall, this place is a great spot if you're craving some Asian food.  They've got a lot of variety so you don't have to limit yourself to a specific cuisine. The presentation of the food and the decor of the restaurant is definitely a foodie's Instagram paradise.  I also love their mission of being organic, ecofriendly, and giving back to the community.

YwKnAa-yO3zDwmOTuDLCkA.text: Be-em is an awesome gem in right out in Matthews! Parking is plentiful since they are in a shopping plaza and it's pretty easy to find. The decor and ambiance in the restaurant were great. I really enjoyed just being in the space with all the greenery and openness. They have a really great variety of menu items with everything from bubble/milk teas to traditional Asian entrees. We tried quite a few things! A few of my favorites were the Korean BBQ bowl, the kimchi fries, and their wings were great! The staff is also super cool and super patient. They can make great recommendations on things to try if you want. All in all, this will be one of my go to places to get my Asian food!

cMHsw3jVcw7Xq6lxGZKaqQ.text: Food was so delicious! It's a great place for anyone looking to eat healthy but who also want to eat out.

Wf0uNVYfAKFFUW4ZqkLJwA.text: I hate even writing this review because I know this hidden gem will not be hidden for long. Food is fresh, yummy and fast. Love the decor. Only wish they had wine...

eq8m8O03LvhuhziSsadY8g.text: So I finally made my way to Be Em Asian Kitchen after talking about going for awhile amongst co-workers. This place is awesome! It's easy to find with a WalMart being close by too.  This place isn't your typical Asian restaurant though. It's a fast-casual place. You order at the counter then they give you a number then bring the food out to you when the food is ready. Definitely a plus for me since most Asian restaurants take their sweet time bringing the check when you're ready to leave. (hate waiting)  The interior is really nice! Love the moss on the walls. The employees were very helpful in helping me choose what I wanted to order. I got the tuna nachos. They were amazing. Crispy chips with the freshness of the tuna and whatever sauce they drizzled on top, damn it was good. I also got the filet and shrimp kabob entree. It's basically hibachi but I've never had a filet and shrimp kabob with hibachi so I ordered it. It was delicious and was such a huge portion. It even came with a side of soup! The filet and shrimp was cooked perfectly. So good that when I reheated my leftovers, it was still had that melt in your mouth feeling.   And the PassionFruit drink! I'm typically not a fruit drink type of person but decided to get it since I was in a splurge type moment. Boy, I was not disappointed. Not overly sweet but super refreshing. It definitely gave me some life at the end of a long work day.  What a perfect place for me to come during my lunch break during the week. Going to have to try and bring my coworkers now.

rFJA5A_WtpwiRM-kdN-JYw.text: Be-Em Asian Kitchen is PHOnominal!   Be Em is a family-owned, Asian fusion restaurant with tastes from Korean, Japanese, Vietnamese and Chinese cuisines. This place is very warm and inviting. I love the modern decor, it's eye-catching and fresh.  Be Em uses non-GMO ingredients and believe it or not you CAN taste the freshness.   The menu offers tasty options ready to excite your palate! I ordered the Pan Fried Chicken Dumplings (4PCS) and Be Em's Signature Bowl - Comes with Shrimp tempura, spicy tuna, seaweed salad, spicy crab mix, avocado, scallions, cucumber, sesame & sweet chili. I enjoyed both menu items, very tasty!

photos.caption: Photo of Be-Em Asian Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bé Em&#39;s Signature Bowl

DiwFJDhfwkVJYn2IFSuriQ.text: Always wanted to try this because I kept seeing popping up on Facebook and Instagram as my some of my friends had been there! Very talked about and it was always in the back of my head.  Anyways, we came during lunch!  When you first walk in, very beautiful opened space and love, love the extreme vaulted ceilings. The decorations were very simple, but I absolute love the green to it.  At first I thought it was a "please wait to be seated" kind of thing but it wasn't so don't stand at the door looking silly waiting for someone to come seat you. You order and pay at the counter and will bring you food.  My husband and I (plus 4 little children) ordered pan fried dumplings, crispy wonton bites, firecracker bites, be em's dac biet, be em's signature poke bowl, Korean bbq beef bowl and chicken & shrimp teriyaki plate!  Pan Fried Dumpling: Crispy and juicy! Loved everything about it. The sauce was perfect and every bite was delicious.  Crispy Wonton Bites: it was crispy as mentioned, but dripping with oil. I mean, it didn't really bother me, but it was kind of messy. Came with sweet chili sauce, but it's already delicious without it.  Firecracker Bites: I was extremely disappointed on this appetizer. It was soggy and didn't have a lot of sauce to cover it. I was not a fan.   Be Em's Dac Biet Pho: Okay, I'm always hesitant to try pho, but my niece said it was better than my favorite pho back here at my city so we HAD to try it. The broth was very, very similar to my favorite pho joint. I could honestly drink the broth itself. So if the broth is good, the pho should be good too and it was. My kids enjoyed it so much!! But my husband said he should had gotten the oxtail one instead. It might had been even better.   Be Em's Signature Poke Bowl: This bowl is actually really delicious. But I think it would had been better if the bowl was a little bit bigger and had more sauce. It was a little hard to mix it all, but it was good.   Korean BBQ Beef Bowl: This now is on point. I really like that sweet red sauce they had in it. The egg was cooked to perfection and once mixed, my taste bud just explodes with many delicious sauce.   Chicken & Shrimp Teriyaki with Rice: Everything on this plate was super good. Usually I don't do teriyaki, but I had to try it because my kids said it was good and usually they don't say such thing and it was yummy. I think if they cut the chicken pieces a bit smaller, it would had been more eatable! Haha, other than that, it was super good.  Overall, this place is bomb. I would come back if I am around the area. Not yet try their teas so I will def come back for that.

Uvis7ijPfPAznAn1J7Rwsw.text: Be-Em Asian Kitchen is a charming mom and pop establishment in Charlotte. One of my gfs recommended this place during our quick trip to NC one weekend and I was ecstatic to try this place out. Check out their website on their story: be-em.com. We ordered a plethora of Small-Bites and apps dishes to try out. All dishes were made to order with fresh, local/organic ingredients; I love that there are substitutions available depending on your dietary needs and restrictions. Favorites were: Pan Fried Dumplings, Crispy Wonton Bites, Be Em's Famous Wings, Kamikaze Filet Kimchi Fries, Sesame Ahi Tuna Nachos, Chicken Lettuce Wraps, and Vietnamese Street Tacos. Portion sizes are massive and perfect for groups. Also, their Cafe Sua Da and fruit teas are delightful. Refreshing on an extremely hot, summer day. You can't go wrong with any of the menu items, even the kiddos enjoyed it!

sLEy6niuQqUCAeUhjZtbhw.text: My coworker told me about this place and how I needed to try it. But I looked it up and it was a bit of a hike from where I live. Then a week later, I passed this trying to kill time before my orthodontist appointment and realized it's not that far of a drive. Finally made it out and it's definitely worth the drive!  We walked in and were surprised how nice it is inside. Most Asian restaurants (the authentic ones at least) aren't really decorated so modern or at all. We took a look at the menu and they have a variety of options, Vietnamese, Korean, Chinese, and Hawaiian. Normally restaurants aren't good at all, but from what we tried (street tacos, pho, poke, boba tea) they can definitely excel in all.   We ordered a small plate thinking it would be small portions. Yet again, we were wrong. Good size portion that left us full but wanting to eat more because it was so yummy. The food came out super fast for a fast casual restaurant. The Vietnamese Street taco with steak was delish and very reasonably priced. The pho tai with short rib and filet strips is hands down the best pho I've had in Charlotte (and I've been on the hunt for 4 years). The short rib, which was still on the bone for maximum flavor, was so tender and juicy! I didn't think it could get much better, but then I tried my fiancee's Hawaiian poke bowl (sub salmon for spicy tuna) and we were in food coma heaven. He said it was the best poke he's had in Charlotte too! The lychee boba tea was the perfect ending to wake us up! And to top it off, the tea was cold with no ice for max beverage!  The one thing a restaurant should invest in is quality meats, and Be-Em did just that. They have such a huge selection of meats too. We will definitely be back every time we're in the mood for anything Asian (which is quite often)!

Photo of Be-Em Asian Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pho tai with short ribs and filet (tip: dip the bread in the broth)

1AcIeUkFfYAPumXwPoQ7JA.text: If you live in the Charlotte area anywhere outside of South End/Elizabeth/Dilworth/Plaza Midwood, you're likely tired of everyone you know that does live in those areas touting them as if they're the center of Charlotte culture and nothing exists outside of those areas.    Be-Em is the perfect answer to those charges.  With a trendy, "South End" type of poke-Korean appeal in an admittedly non-"hip" location (this place could easily be on South Blvd rather than off of Sardis, but I'm not complaining), Be-Em really is something special compared to the surrounding area.  Our group ordered:  -Korean BBQ Beef Bowl: This is by far the best thing on the menu.  The beef is moist, flavorful and absolutely delicious.  Served with a fried egg, kimchi, rice, amongst other things, this bowl is a meal on its own and is probably going to be my go to when I go back in the future.  -Pan fried dumplings: The best starter/"small plate" on our order.  The dumplings are fresh, piping-hot and the sauce was delicious.  Definitely a must-try.  -Crispy wonton bites: Also another good starter, but in a pinch/if I weren't just trying to sample a bunch of things on the menu, I'd probably go for the pan-fried dumplings.  -Crunchy california bowl: We weren't a fan of the crunchy california bowl as much.  While it was okay for a poke-bowl, it is definitely overshadowed by the Korean BBQ Beef Bowl.  -Vietnamese street tacos: Pretty average for small-plate tacos.  Probably not something we'd order again.  -Chicken and shrimp (teriyaki): Again, pretty much average chicken and shrimp teriyaki.  Not this place's specialty, nor does it claim to be, and you can do better on other places of the menu.  Overall, a really good experience and I'm so glad that a trendy, delicious restaurant has finally opened somewhere convenient to those of us that don't live within a mile of uptown.

photos.caption: Photo of Be-Em Asian Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. First round of our order.  Chicken and Shrimp Entree, Crunch California Bowl, Crispy Wonton Bites

EgtNEL5OfusBJ7rzgNao6Q.text: Thanks to a good tip from a friend, I tried their Firecracker Shrimp today...and WOW, it was AMAZING! Such a generous portion of perfectly spicy Shrimps with a bed of Prawn Chips. I also tried their signature Fresh Coconut drink served in a cool, rustic shell...and as expected, it was Dee-Lish! Since I'm CooCoo over Coconuts anyway, I would have loved it every which way. I only wish there was more of it inside the shell.  Like I said last time, I really like the modern, eco-friendly decor here...and I love the super-comfy booths. The place is quite spacious as well, with a cool, relaxing vibe! I only wish they had overhead music (something lively, something Asian, or maybe New Age to match its eco-friendly style?) would add some spark to the place. Just a suggestion!  If this restaurant wasn't so far from my home, I can easily see myself hanging out regularly.   Anyway, if you haven't been, you're missing out. Check it out...and soon!

97CSlXcq4HXksfV9QFECKA.text: When's the last time you had a meal and everything was good?! Today was that day for me! Be-em Asian Kitchen is a True Asian fusion restaurant with Japanese, Vietnamese and Korean influences!  The restaurant's decor was very nice and modern. The staff was very welcoming and helpful with menu suggestions. The manager Dee (Bear) was very polite and made sure we felt at home.   Ok on to the food! My friend and I had the following:   * Be-em spring rolls -crispy outside but flavor wise just ok. * Kamikaze filet Kim chi fries -OMG! The BEST thing on the menu by far! Must try!  * Korean bbq beef bowl -yummy and flavorful. Love the sesame flavor paired with the Korean bbq and kimchi  * Vietnamese street tacos (steak) -soo savory and yummy! Has a little kick, if you don't prefer spicy, omit the fresh jalapeno.  * Chicken teriyaki  -chicken, zucchini, broccoli. Teriyaki sauce was on the sweeter side. * Mango crush & passionfruit fresh fruit teas -LOVED these fresh made drinks. My favorite was the mango crush which had jelly pieces and chia seeds, yum!  I will DEFINITELY be returning soon as this is a new favorite!

9bdWeB49kOGc9__ImONG0g.text: This is definitely a hidden gem! I had such a fabulous experience and can't wait to go back!  The decor is beautiful- very earthy and zen. I love the "living walls" covered in moss. There's plenty of tables and seating. They also have a few tables outside.   You order at the counter - the menu is huge!! It used to be a hibachi spot and the hibachi really blew me away! The shrimp I had had amazing flavor and was great quality.   I also tried the poke bowls- they are huge and delicious! Tons of fresh fish and toppings.   They have Asian inspired tacos- I loved the seared tofu. Perfect for vegetarians and great flavor and texture. Would be fun to share as an app too (comes with 3 tacos)  You MUST get the coconut !! They cut open a fresh coconut for you to drink the coconut water out of. It was such a special experience and so unique! I felt like I was in the islands.   The tuna wonton nachos were a delicious app. Great for sharing and covered in tons of tuna, avocado, seaweed salad and sauces.   They firecracker shrimp were delicious tempura style. They were pretty spicy!  Overall I had a great experience. They staff are so sweet and welcoming. They helped me decide and explained the menu for me.

x896NUAHVS9balWdx87-SA.text: It was such a pleasure having dinner at Be em. This hidden gem has been open since December and I'm a little upset that I hadn't tried it sooner. No worries, though, because I tried enough dishes to make up for lost times. If you're craving Asian cuisine but would also prefer fresh and natural ingredients, this is definitely a place for you. I can't wait to take all of my friends back! The customer service I received from Adah and the rest of the staff was AMAZING.   Mango Crush fruit tea with the perfect amount of sweetness Steak Vietnamese street tacos with a subtle  kick  Koji karaage chicken with sweet chili sauce for a sweet and savory combination  Crispy wonton bites served hot with the perfect amount of crunch  Teriyaki Chicken and scallop plate w/ fried rice  Fresh Coconut   Be sure to check out the dessert teas as well!

9YJ0UzfAOBVZaE31QEuliA.text: I am so mad I found this place right before I stopped working in the area! Or I guess it's a good thing because they would have taken all my money. I've been here 3 times since then and everything has been really good.  It has a quick service feel so when you walk in you go to the counter to order. They do have menus setup by the front door as you walk in. The decor is really nice and they have plenty of seating. They have a pretty big menu from small bites, soups and salads, hibachi, pho, and poke bowls.  My two favorite things right now are the kamikaze filet Kim chi fries and the sesame ahi tuna nachos! Both are sooooo delicious and full of flavor!  Also got starters, the pan fried dumplings are good but didn't like the crispy wonton bites they were blah, ate one didn't want the rest.  Definitely we come back when on this side of town.

1tfp7nJ6t4B5gv84GPvNJA.text: Had been wanting to try this place for a while. It's an Asian fusion restaurant with a little bit of everything, Chinese, Vietnamese. Korean, Japanese, etc... you order at the counter and take a number and they'll bring the food out to you. I have a broken leg and came in with crutches, and the nice girl at the counter actually told me to sit down and she would come take my order. That's amazing service. I ordered hibachi chicken and shrimp and my friend ordered the pho. Also ordered the wings and a thai iced tea with coffee jelly. Thai tea was great, strong tea flavor without being overtly sweet. Chicken wings with thai chili sauce was fried very well. Nice and crisp. The hibachi chicken and shrimp came with a salad and soup, the portion was humongous. The pho was also a good portion size. Overall a great little restaurant and I'd highly recommend it.

ERi6CbO8xS_KrpULojm_KA.text: Was on my way to Walmart on a Saturday evening and saw the Be-Em sign. I recognized the restaurant name from a random Instagram ad I had seen a few weeks back. I recall an image featuring their signature logo on these wooden boards that they serve food on.   Walked in and my first impression was wow! The decor was so beautiful and seemed way out of the league compared to the surrounding areas' restaurants.   I did not expect the restaurant to be fast casual from the initial marketing, but I did rather enjoy the idea of paying prior to eating so that I could get on with my night and not wait for a server.   I ordered the wings, shrimp appetizer and Korean BBQ beef bowl. The shrimp was 10/10, wings 7/10 and beef bowl 7/10. I would score the beef bowl higher but I felt like I needed just a tad bit more flavor or sauce in it.   Overall, i had a nice experience. It's a large restaurant and a great place to grab food with friends. Think chipotle meets glamour!

iyLY9jzK_XqYwoSplrey6Q.text: This place had been showing up on Yelp recently with a lot of good reviews. We decided to take our Monday off and make the drive out to Matthews to check it out.   We went with a group of people so we got a bunch of small plates and shared everything. It's fast casual so you order, take a number, find a seat, and they bring your food to you. The food came out very quickly.  We tried: veggie spring rolls, crispy wonton bites, Thai sweet chili wings, kamikaze filet kimchi fries, sesame ahi tuna nachos, firecracker shrimp, Koji karaage chicken, shrimp Vietnamese street tacos, a custom hibachi plate, and the Korean BBQ beef bowl.  Everything was great. I think my absolute favorite was the Korean BBQ beef bowl. It's under the poke bowl section on the menu which is misleading because it's really more of bibimbap. Some other favorites were the wings (very crispy), the tacos, the firecracker shrimp, the nachos, and the fries.   The couple of things I wasn't a huge fan of were the Koji Karaage Chicken (really needed sauce) and the hibachi (wasn't bad, just didn't compare to how good the other dishes were). Both of these were still good, they just didn't stand out.   I would highly recommend checking this place out if you like Asian food!

The only thing I could have done with out were the spring rolls, mainly because i didn't notice they were fried. Everything else was great. I'll be going back for poke and more noodles- you can never have enough soba noodles In your life.

Zps4tuowcDE6coVZ_rNnyQ.text: Remodeling gone wrong... we have eaten at this restaurant when it was under the Shiki name and loved it.  Since rebranding, our experience has t been the best.  We are there shortly after it re-opened and it took forever.  We then decided to do take out only.  The first take out order was wrong.   We were missing our soup and they quickly replaced it but then once home we realized there was no shrimp sauce.  Our most recent visit was sub-par.  While the order were correct, the food was terrible.  Our onion soup had a foul taste.  So much so that we refused to eat it.  I ordered a chicken plate with mixed veggies and it seemed well cooked but flavorless.  We knew immediately after eating that something wasn't cooked well.  The next day I was sick the entire day and 2 days after eating it, still am.  It's quite disappointing as this has been a go to place for years prior to remodeling/rebranding.  Sad to say, we won't be returning.

-B3nMx29KYixoge00URMkQ.text: I love pho ! One late night my favorite place down independence closed early (an actual authentic Vietnamese food place) so I decided to try this mind you I live about 25-30mins away I come by and take two pho's to go to my surprise when I get home there is RAW meat in plastic wrap with the rest of ingredients not ones as many time as I have taking pho to go at my fav spot have I gotten raw meat, usually it's  already swimming in the broth "cooking " while you are driving home  !!!! I was shocked !!! Everyone knows the broth is piping hot when they pour it over raw meat and  sense the meat is so thin it cooks very fast well by the time I got home my broth was warm not nearly enough to cook the meat , I honestly think this is some sorta food violations code to even do something like that

GpE7ta_riYtcPZnXhPrwUg.text: Perfect spot for great, delicious, and reasonably priced Chinese/Vietnamese and I love that you can order online for a quick pickup. Service has been great and I love their new menu and interior. I keep trying new foods and everything has been great, from the kimchi fries to the tuna nachos (tuna, avocado, and some delicious sauce on fried wonton "chips"). Pretty solid poke bowls and they have some killer pho options (oxtail and spare rib). Super happy to get an easy and enticing lunch/dinner option in the area.

Z7UfvIqu-vAu_W22hNA-jw.text: I'm going to have to disagree with most reviewers of Be-Em. Based on reviews and personal recommendations we decided to have lunch at Be-Em today.  First of all I'm not fond of restaurants where you order in a line like you're at a fast food restaurant, I like to sit down and leisurely decide what I'd like to order. Ignoring the mechanics of the ordering process I ordered the shrimp plate with rice, mixed vegetables and hibachi sauce and was very disappointed in the quality of the food. The food was flavorless, the rice was cold and the carrots were so bland and mushy that I suspect they were served straight out of a can. I definitely won't be visiting Be-Em again.

bxVrppRKvWbwXa1WG5knew.text: Went there with the famil a couple weeks ago and everything was amazing food was great pirces were good service was amazing love it went back the other day and will continue to go back other resturants can learn a thing or two abiut customer service from them

WQaApzRjHiBkJZf-NALk8g.text: Really enjoyed our lunch today. To start off, we're not your typical customers. We order A LOT off the menu that way we know what to and what not to order next go around, if there is a next time. We ordered the short rib Pho and added ox tail, wings, Vietnamese tacos, firecracker shrimp, shiu mai, Poke bowl, kimchi fries, egg rolls and something else, can't remember what else, but washed it all down with a nice fresh young coconut! I'm about 45 minutes away, so it'll be a while before we go there again, but it's a definite stop when I'm in the area. The locals have a real gem here. Go get you some!

evvwxQ7tgUYLtDpI0cVJpA.text: Formerly Shiki, this restaurant has gone through a significant upgrade from what it was previously. I asked and was told the daughter of the previous owner is now in charge and she did a great job giving the place a fresh new look. The interior has nice green plants and love the wood interior. This restaurant is a welcome addition to the area: you can get poke bowls, pho, and other Asian fusion dishes. The best dish we had were the kimchi fries. Don't be fooled by the "small bites" menu- the portions are HUGe! A better name could be Starters. The waffle fries were nice and crispy and topped with delicious marinated beef, kimchi, cheese and cilantro. I also got the Ahi Poke bowl and it was decent- not the best I've had. One suggestion is that the poke bowls need a sauce to tie it all together. We also ordered the wings and they were decent- they were cooked well but too mild in flavor for my liking. They aren't korean fried wings, just small lightly fried wings. Overall very impressed with the change and will definitely be back!

JkLZnSFhPESKG3dbZCcbWQ.text: We have been looking for good hibachi around Charlotte for the longest time and I am glad to say we have finally found it! Today, I ordered the chicken hibachi with fried rice and vegetables and it was so delicious. Each component was super flavorful and fresh and I couldn't have asked for anything more. Not to mention, the atmosphere is super cute and modern. Loved it and totally recommend! I hope to come back soon and try some of their other dishes out!!

mvK8mtcBuG8dNxSWes5QTg.text: The food is very good!  Tried the vegetable dumplings (delicious), shrimp & steak hibachi, generous portion, the steak perfectly prepared.  The noodles were a bit over cooked for my taste.  The ginger salad was good.  If you don't like a ton of dressing, ask them to put it in the side.  They really pile it on.  Only disappointment was the onion soup.  A bit sweet.  Will return for sure.

zUymRgDAe56fMugGW_oIRg.text: Great place to get the food you love. The staff is friendly and quick. You can get it to go too, but stay and enjoy the place it's nice. Only thing I think is a little odd is the wooden tray they give ya. Great for presentation, but I dunno, just different. Wont keep me from coming back tho!

Gg3heCT1s7Pl8p-lfPbBBg.text: Horrible service. It took over an hour to get a take out order tonight and they kept telling us "only 10 more minutes". We have eaten here before and the food was pretty good, but nothing is worth the horrible service and wait time.

sqcyHDJvwMUw4zmssOLmAg.text: Consistently delicious! Great service, even better food. Love the pho, poke bowls, and shrimp dumplings! Carry out is nice from here as well as dine in

d8IphmEjMGEil8g9bW2ehA.text: I came with family and kid. Ordered the plates with noodle and fried rice and crispy shrimp as starter. The starter was good. Rest all food was sauggy not hot and oily watery sauce. Fell sick afterwards and never gonna come again.

4_hy8yjgMZwG2vPs3Imw2w.text: One of my favorite quick stop restaurant. Call in for order, ready in 10 minutes. I love the Korean bbq poke bowl. OMG the firecracker shrimp! Delicious!! Best of all, it is 10 minutes from work!

bbs3as0p9iHof5Fvdv396Q.text: First, very clean, simple and organized.  Nice seating with plenty of room for both couples seating and families with young kids (strollers, etc.).  Not too pricy at around $9 a plate.  The food is very fresh and served in a very beautiful way where you finish the creation, with soups at least, by adding the fresh veggies served next to your noodle bowl.  This means the flavors of the soup were not all mushed together but tasted separate and unique in the bowl, a really great way to enjoy your meal.  The meats were cooked just right, neither over or under done.  Great background music that wasn't too loud, which added to the great experience.  Lastly, the staff visited us while we ate, not just to ask the obligatory "how is everything" but also to make a recommendation on what to try next time.  Most helpful.  Overall, a great and recommended eating experience!

eGjJNjkZeOfWl4d2LpUKrg.text: This place was fabulous! Restaurant was very clean. Wait staff friendly. We ordered kimchi fries, chicken fried dumplings, shrimp teriyaki entree and hibachi chicken and steak, it was all amazing. Food came out super fast and hot. Can't wait to come back and try the pho.
